post.html:
This particular smoke was inspired by Meathead’s Last meal Ribs. Nearly all of my grilling is inspired by Meathead’s methods. The ribs were dry-brined, rubbed, smoked, cut, and brought to a party. They were a hit!

The ribs

This paricular cut of ribs was purchased from Sam’s Club. They’re labeled “Pork Baby Back Ribs” and come in a vacuum sealed pack with three full slabs. This day they ran at $2.88/lb and at 8.45lb they rang in at $24.34. As soon as I brought them home from the store, I removed the membrane from the back to encourage tenderness. In this cook, I smoked two of the slabs and saved one for another day.

Marinading the turkey

The cook

This cut of turkey went on the grill at 12:30pm. It was set at 350 degrees, but with winter temperatures in the teens, the temp hovered around 310-330 degrees.

1 hour in it was at 105 degrees. The ribs reached 165 at 2:30pm, for a total time on the grill at 2 hours.
